declarations.comments:
Insert new row(s) above the row at given index:
If the second argument is `Nothing`, the data will be inserted after the last column/row.

`alter action index amount source keepEmpty hot`.
declarations.title: alter

declarations.comments: Clears the grid.
declarations.title: clear

declarations.comments: Get the index of first visible column.
declarations.title: colOffset

declarations.comments: Returns the total number of columns in the grid.
declarations.title: countCols

declarations.comments:
Returns number of empty columns. If the `ending` parameter is `true`, returns number of
empty columns at right hand edge of the table.
declarations.title: countEmptyCols

declarations.comments:
Returns number of empty rows. If the `ending` parameter is `true`, returns
number of empty rows at the bottom of the table.
declarations.title: countEmptyRows

declarations.comments: Return the number of visible columns.
declarations.title: countRenderedCols

declarations.comments: Return the number of rendered rows.
declarations.title: countRenderedRows

declarations.comments: Total number of rows in the grid.
declarations.title: countRows

declarations.comments: Number of visible columns. Returns `-1` if the table is not visible
declarations.title: countVisibleCols

declarations.comments: Number of visible rows (rendered rows that fully fit inside viewport)
declarations.title: countVisibleRows

declarations.comments: Deselects current cell selection in the grid.
declarations.title: deselectCell

declarations.comments: Remove the grid from the DOM.
declarations.title: destroy

declarations.comments:
Returns the TD element for given `row`, `col` if it is rendered on screen.
Returns `Nothing` if the TD is not rendered on screen (probably because that part of table is not visible).
declarations.title: getCell

declarations.comments: Get the cell editor by row and col.
declarations.title: getCellEditor

declarations.comments: Get cell properties for given row and col.
declarations.title: getCellMeta

declarations.comments: Return column headers (if they are enabled), `Nothing` otherwise.
declarations.title: getColHeader

declarations.comments: Get the width of the given column
declarations.title: getColWidth

declarations.comments:
Get value of selected range. Each column is separated by tab, each row is separated by new line character.

`getCopyableData startRow startCol endRow endCol`
declarations.title: getCopyableData

declarations.comments:
Return the current data table (the same that was passed by data configuration option or loadData method).
Optionally you can provide cell range `startCoord`, `endCoord` to get only a fragment of grid data.
declarations.title: getData

declarations.comments:
Return cell value at row, col. row and col are the visible indexes
(note that if columns were reordered or sorted, the current order will be used).
declarations.title: getDataAtCell

declarations.comments: Returns array of column values from the data source. `col` is the visible index of the column.
declarations.title: getDataAtCol

declarations.comments: Returns a single row of the data. `row` is the visible index of the row.
declarations.title: getDataAtRow

declarations.comments: Return row headers (if they are enabled), `Nothing` otherwise.
declarations.title: getRowHeader

declarations.comments: Get the height of the given row.
declarations.title: getRowHeight

declarations.comments:
Get schema provided by constructor settings or if it doesn't exist return schema based on data
structure on the first row.
declarations.title: getSchema

declarations.comments:
Return index of the currently selected cells as an array `[startRow, startCol, endRow, endCol]`.
Start row and start col are the coordinates of the active cell (where the selection was started).
declarations.title: getSelected

declarations.comments: Returns current selection, or `Nothing` if there is no selection.
declarations.title: getSelectedRange

declarations.comments: Get the current grid settings
declarations.title: getSettings

declarations.comments: Returns array of column values from the data source. `col` is the index of the row in the data source.
declarations.title: getSourceDataAtCol

declarations.comments: Returns a single row of the data. `row` is the index of the row in the data source.
declarations.title: getSourceDataAtRow

declarations.comments: Get the value from the selected cell, `Nothing` if no cell is selected.
declarations.title: getValue

declarations.comments: Returns information of this table is configured to display column headers.
declarations.title: hasColHeaders

declarations.comments: Returns information of this table is configured to display row headers.
declarations.title: hasRowHeaders

declarations.comments: Check if col is empty.
declarations.title: isEmptyCol

declarations.comments: Check if row is empty.
declarations.title: isEmptyRow

declarations.comments: Returns true if current Handsontable instance is listening to keyboard input on document body.
declarations.title: isListening

declarations.comments: Listen to keyboard input on document body.
declarations.title: listen

declarations.comments: Reset all cells in the grid to contain data from the data array.
declarations.title: loadData

declarations.comments:
Populate cells at position with a 2D input array (e.g. [[1, 2], [3, 4]]):

`populateFromArray start input end source method dir deltas hot`

Use `end` when you want to cut input when certain row/column is reached.
Optional `source` parameter (default value `PopulateFromArray`) is used
to identify this call in the resulting events (beforeChange, afterChange).
Optional method parameter (default value `Overwrite` has the same effect as the `pasteMethod` option.

Returns ending td in populated area, or `Nothing` if no cell was changed.
declarations.title: populateFromArray

declarations.comments: Remove `key` property object from cell meta data corresponding to params of cell at `row`, `col`.
declarations.title: removeCellMeta

declarations.comments: Re-render the table.
declarations.title: render

declarations.comments: Get the index of the first visible row.
declarations.title: rowOffset

declarations.comments:
Select cell `start` or maybe range of cells finishing at `end`.
By default, viewport will be scrolled to selection and after selectCell
call instance will be listening to keyboard input on document.
declarations.title: selectCell

declarations.comments: Sets cell meta data object key corresponding to params row, col.
declarations.title: setCellMeta

declarations.comments: Set cell meta data object prop to corresponding params row, col
declarations.title: setCellMetaObject

declarations.comments:
Set a new value to a cell. `col` is the index of a visible column (note that if columns were reordered,
the current order will be used). `source` is a flag for before/afterChange events.
declarations.title: setDataAtCell

declarations.comments: Adds/removes data from the column. This function is modelled after JavaScript's Array.splice.
declarations.title: spliceCol

declarations.comments: Adds/removes data from the row. This function is modelled after JavaScript's Array.splice.
declarations.title: spliceRow

declarations.comments: Stop listening to keyboard input in document body.
declarations.title: unlisten

declarations.comments:
Validates all cells using their validator functions and calls callback when finished. Does not render the view.
If one of cells is invalid callback will be fired with 'valid' arguments as false otherwise true.
declarations.title: validateCells
